poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The toads are in their heaven - one snug In a gardening shoe. The Filipina's toes Trigger a shriek. Two flip through the cat door Conjoined. One meditates in a bandolier of worms; Tomes of exegesis bud in its jewelled head Too soon, too complex for its warty neurons. Ah me, the bell tolls. Its rope tows An apprentice ringer off his feet, to wonder What troves of rhyme await us under grass that can't distinguish The tones of the cow bell from the chant of the cow.
